children.subject: Since you responded (thank you!), what exactly was fixed? On schedule planner there still appears to be a conflict.

This is now fixed.

Scheduling involves many variables and we don't intentionally schedule class conflicts, which is why the lectures are not at the same times. It's a lot to keep track of and we try our best.

Since as you said, staff are not regularly checking this page anymore, future EE and EECS scheduling questions can be directed to: ee-scheduling@eecs.berkeley.edu.

history.content:
This is a super common combination to take, and, like apparently many other super common combinations, these classes coincide for Spring 2018. The conflict arises from the placement of both EE 105 discussion sections during EE 120 lecture. Is there any possibility that these sections might be shifted so as to allow these courses to be taken together (although I personally don't plan on doing so, another class of mine also coincides with these discussion sections)?

EDIT: Staff doesn't check Piazza anymore, I guess ignore this...
history.subject: Spring 2018 EE 105 and EE 120 conflict
